translated: The Paṭṭhāna Treatise🔽The reverse order of the law of conditionality, the text of the Paṭṭhāna according to the triads

original: Dhammapaccanīyānuloma (4), Tikapaṭṭhānapāḷi (1)🔽19.6. Vitakkattika🔽Nasavitakkasavicāraṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca savitakkasavicāro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi  vitakkattika  na sa vitakka sa vicāram dhammam paṭicca sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: The triad on applied thought🔽With a state that is not accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought as condition, a state accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought arises, a condition being by way of root condition.

original: Nasavitakkasavicāraṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca avitakkavicāramatto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Nasavitakkasavicāraṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca avitakkaavicāro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … satta.
analyzed: na sa vitakka sa vicāram dhammam paṭicca avitakka vicāra mattaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā  na sa vitakka sa vicāram dhammam paṭicca avitakka avicāraḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā satta
translated: With a state that is not accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought as condition, a state accompanied by applied thought and not accompanied by sustained thought arises, a condition being by way of root condition.🔽With a state that is not accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought as condition, a state not accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought arises, a condition being by way of root condition … seven.

original: Naavitakkavicāramattaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca avitakkavicāramatto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … satta.
analyzed: na avitakka vicāra mattam dhammam paṭicca avitakka vicāra mattaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā satta
translated: With a state accompanied by applied thought and not accompanied by sustained thought as condition, a state accompanied by applied thought and not accompanied by sustained thought arises, a condition being by way of root condition … seven.

original: Naavitakkaavicāraṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca avitakkaavicāro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … satta. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na avitakka avicāram dhammam paṭicca avitakka avicāraḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā satta
translated: With a state not accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought as condition, a state not accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought arises, a condition being by way of root condition … seven. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā ekūnapaññāsa, ārammaṇe tiṁsa, adhipatiyā ekūnatiṁsa …pe… purejāte āsevane ekūnatiṁsa …pe… avigate ekūnapaññāsa.
analyzed: hetuyā ekūnapaññāsa ārammaṇe tisa adhipatiyā ekūnatisa pe purejāte āsevane ekūnatisa pe avigate ekūnapaññāsa
translated: As root cause, forty-nine; as object, thirty; as predominance, forty-nine; as prenascence, forty-nine; as postnascence, forty-nine; as repetition, forty-nine; as dissociation, forty-nine; as presence, forty-nine; as absence, forty-nine; as non-appearance, forty-nine; as disappearance, forty-nine; as non-disappearance, forty-nine; as the four noble truths, forty-nine.
